intro: Rubus henriquesii, commonly known as the Henriques' bramble, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. This shrub typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and features thorny stems with alternate, palmately compound leaves. Its flowers are small, usually white or pink, and appear in clusters, followed by red or black berries. The plant is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests or mountainous areas.
